dl.dd: Type: one of the values below
The state of the template.XULElem("window"). It can have one of the following values:

ul.li: maximized: The window is maximized, and occupies the full size of the screen.
normal: The window appears in a normal state at the desired size.

body.p: Note: When a window is minimized, the sizemode attribute is not updated. This is done so that if a window is closed while minimized, its persisted sizemode attribute wouldn't be minimized.
This attribute is used to save and restore the state of a window (together with persist attribute) and for CSS styles (e.g. to hide the resizer grippy on maximized windows).
Setting this attribute does not change the window state. Use window.maximize(), window.restore(), or window.minimize() to change the window state.
To get the window state from JavaScript code, use window.windowState.
Issues with this attribute (at least on Firefox 3):

ul.li: sizemode doesn't work on Mac OS X (bug 409095)
On platforms where sizemode works, it isn't always updated properly (bug 419292)

li.p: sizemode is only updated when the value of the persist attribute on the root element (such as <window>) contains sizemode.
